sections.sectionText:
Working with PWM and servo motors 
This project has a servo motor connected to PB6, a switch connected to PA4 and a laser connected to pin PA2.
The device will read in the status of the pull up pin PA4 to see if the switch has been toggled, and then will start operation of the toy
When the device is on, pin PA2 will be set and the laser turned on. Then the bigBounce method will be called, then the randomBounce method, and then the bigBounce method again before looping
bigBounce takes no arguments and will first look at the value in the timer compare register to see where the servo is currently positioned, and then will start at the opposite end and slowly move across to the other side
randomBounce takes no arguments and will generate a random number between 0 and 14, and based on that number will call randomWobble with a different base position argument
randomWobble will take an base, an int and will then move in a quick back and forth motion around that base position

title: Writing a Display Driver for a 1602 Display

sections.sectionText: This is a WIP, much like my website

After graduating Trent with a CS degree I have been slowly poking away at my website trying to polish it up. Originally I had a little site written up in PHP with some basic CSS styling however I got bored pretty quickly and gave up. This write up talks about my experience redoing my website with React using Material UI to make it nice and pretty

images.imageAlternateText: picture of my old gross website

sections.sectionText: I would like my website to have four pages, a home page, a projects page, a selfhosted services page, and a guide page for selfhosting services. The home page could have a preamble talking about me and then I would like to have it have a sample of each subpage displayed on it. I am going to start with the projects page as that is the page that I have the most content for and that I think will allow me to show what I have been working on. Then I will implement a home page that has the projects page displayed on it multiple times that will be slowly replaced when I finish the selfhosted services and guide pages complete.

Currently the projects page will get all of its data from a json file that contains an array of projects. Each project will have multiple sections in it that contain a section title, section text and then an  array of images that contains the image location as well as alternate text and image width properties
I don't have any key lessons learned as of yet because I'm still working on it in the early stages
